subject: Learning
title: Multimodal Learning: What Works Instead
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Multimodal Learning: What Works Instead.

hook.text: If targeting one style doesn't work, what does? Using all of them together.

buildup.text: Multimodal instruction combines visuals, audio, text, and activity in a single lesson.

discovery.text: Dual coding theory shows that pairing words with images creates two memory traces instead of one.

twist.text: It works for everyoneâ€”not because of styles, but because multiple channels reinforce the same idea.

climax.text: The best teachers don't sort students. They enrich every lesson with varied representations.

punchline.text: Don't match the style. Multiply the channels.

quiz.question: Why does multimodal instruction work for all learners?
